definition: to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
lit. to fly upwards swiftly/fig. rapid advance/rapidly developing (situation)
(of a liquid) to boil/(of sentiments etc) to boil over/to flare up/to be impassioned
to make (some time or space) available (for sb)
to be fired up (idiom)/to have one's blood racing
to soar/to rise high into the air
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose

sentences.chinese: “怎么样，”腾格拉尔说，“你见到他了吗？”

sentences.english: Wise: The company uses technology developed by the Langer lab and Ted Teng.
sentences.chinese: 该公司使用由兰格实验室和特德腾开发的技术。

sentences.english: At this moment the young man returned; Danglars withdrew.
sentences.chinese: 这时，那青年人回来了，腾格拉尔便乘机溜走了。

sentences.english: All enclosed places are too small for smoking.
sentences.chinese: 这个封闭的小屋子如此狭促，想抽烟都腾不出地方。

sentences.english: it loses its wreath of foam when poured into that of others.
sentences.chinese: 一倒在别人的杯里，这酒的腾跳的泡沫便要消逝落了。

sentences.english: Then how did we address the time-out.
sentences.chinese: 那要怎样定位腾时间呢。

sentences.english: I shall remain and look over the accounts with Danglars.
sentences.chinese: 我还得留下来和腾格拉尔核对一下帐目。

sentences.english: Danglars retreated a step or two.
sentences.chinese: 腾格拉尔向后退了一两步。

sentences.english: We never had a conversation on whether Trooper Wooten should be a trooper or not.
sentences.chinese: 我们从没讨论过州警伍腾是否应该继续任职。

sentences.english: Doctor Hviesten says his pulse is elevated.
sentences.chinese: 赫维斯腾大夫说他的脉博加快了。

sentences.english: Found only in Shuihudi Qin bamboo slips, namely, "South County Mayor Teng instrument."
sentences.chinese: 仅见于睡虎地秦简，即《南郡守腾文书》。
“怎么样，”腾格拉尔说，“你见到他了吗？”

sentences.english: This is the white-xuan Teng world.
sentences.chinese: 这是白色的暄腾的世界。

sentences.english: A cloud passed over Danglars' brow.
sentences.chinese: 腾格拉尔的眉际掠过一片阴云。

sentences.english: They send out Nils Fingleton, the croc man.
sentences.chinese: 他们派出尼尔斯芬格勒腾，鳄鱼先生。

sentences.english: The count turned round as he heard the entrance of Danglars into the room.
sentences.chinese: 伯爵听到腾格拉尔进来的声音就转过身来。

definition: ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]
pool/pond/(of metals etc) luster/favor or beneficence/damp/moist
thick weeds/luxuriant growth/Illicium anisatum, a shrub with poisonous leaves/impertinent
